utterances: She's an exceptional athlete.
We have some swimmers who are swimmers.
She's an athlete that's a swimmer.
And she comes in organized.
She knows exactly what she's going to do.
She doesn't waste a second.
She's something.
Torres swims preliminary heats Friday and Saturday and the final in the 50 meter freestyle sprint Sunday.
Michael Phelps will try in those three days to set Olympic history again.
Three gold medals in the three races on his schedule would make him the biggest gold medal winner in a single Olympics.
He reminded reporters yesterday that he has no lock on that record.
I'm not unbeatable.
No one's unbeatable.
Everyone can be beaten.

American teammate Ryan Lochte is the biggest threat to Phelps in Friday's 200 meter individual medley, and teammate and world record holder Ian Crocker is the big threat in the 100 meter butterfly Saturday.
Swimming analyst Roddy Gaines of NBC says Phelps has two of his toughest races ahead of him.
Not going to be easy.
It'll be a miracle.
I said it at the beginning, and I still say it even after five of them, it'll be a miracle if he wins eight.
By conventional standards, it's miraculous Phelps has gotten this far, and that Dara Torres is even here.
Howard Berkes, NPR News, Beijing.
You can also see the men's 200-meter backstroke tonight, and that's one Michael Phelps actually is not participating in.
Women are competing also in the 200-meter breaststroke, in the 100-meter freestyle tonight, the gold medal, the finals will be live.
It's not just swimming on the schedule tonight.
As we mentioned earlier, there's also women's gymnastics live.
And my favorite sport, beach volleyball, front and center, too.
There will be men's and women's matches featuring the Thin Beast and the Professor.
(Soundbite of laughter)
I'm sorry - what?
These are nicknames - nickname - two American guys who are playing, Phil Dalhausser, Todd Rogers.
They lost their first game against Latvia, but then they beat Switzerland and Argentina, and they're still in the running.
I've been hearing a lot about one of the U.S.
women's teams that you seem to be so fascinated with.
Kerri Walsh and Misty May-Treanor, they beat the Cuban team.
They're now three and oh.
Kerri Walsh lost her wedding - she lost her wedding ring when it slipped off her finger during her first game, but then she got it again after a volunteer found it in the sand.
Now, she's wearing a bandage over it.
Yeah, women's beach volleyball.
Check it out.

NPR's Day to Day continues.
Louisiana State Penitentiary, or Angola Prison, is known for extremes.
It's an enormous, maximum-security prison.
And it's so remote most of the medical needs of the prisoners are met right at the prison.
But according to some inmates and former inmates, that health care has become as harsh as the long sentences.
Amanda Aronczyk of member station WNYC brings us this story.
According to Francis Brauner, this is what happened.
He was serving a 20-year prison sentence for a rape charge that he denies.
He was at Dixon Correctional Institute in Louisiana, where part of his punishment was hard labor.
I was working in the field.
He was cutting grass with a hoe.
And my back was hurting me real bad to the point where if I'd breathe, it was hurting.
He went to see the prison doctor.
Doctor says, you need to go back out into the fields, but you don't have to cut the grass.
Just walk.
From NPR News, this is ALL THINGS CONSIDERED.
I'm Melissa Block.
Well, yeah.
I think particularly if you see California, Florida, and there's talk of New York as well moving up early, to the 5th of February.

Again, to kind of emphasize, people both with high name identification as well as a lot of money, it's going to decrease the chance that you'll see sort of an insurgent develop, coming out of nowhere.
And Wyoming's now made a move - the Republican Party anyway, not the Democratic Party yet - to move up with 12 delegates.
That's pure power.
And we have three electoral votes, so...
Boy.
Awesome power.
(Soundbite of laughter)
Let me ask you gentleman a question that I think is on a lot of people's minds that in a sense I'm going to turn around.
The polls indicate that the vast majority of the American public are absolutely comfortable with a woman as president or an African-American as president.

But I must say, I'm astonished at the high percentage of the American people that say, at least according - at least in certain polls that they're uncomfortable with the idea of a Mormon as president; Governor Romney of Massachusetts obviously a Mormon.
What do you make of this, gentleman?
Well, I think - I think it has to settle in.
They were saying the same things about John Kennedy because he was a Catholic, and he went and addressed it right up front.
He said that, you know, I don't take my directives from the Pope.
I think he made - it was a fascinating statement he made and it didn't denigrate his Catholicism.
But I think that Mitt Romney will handle it the same way.
Yeah.
I think the other thing he will mitigate on the issue too, Scott, is that in this case, you know, the Senate majority leader is a Mormon of...
Orrin Hatch.
Orrin Hatch.
So I think what you'll see is - as the story spreads about other individuals who have this faith, I think the issue is going to become smaller and smaller.
It must be noted too, polls this week indicate that Senator Obama is in fact not the top choice of the majority of African-American voters in this country, at least so far.
It's Senator Clinton.
That, by the way, doesn't surprise me.
I mean former President Clinton was enormously popular with African-American voters.
And my guess is, is that popularity transfers pretty substantially to Senator Clinton.
Would either of you care to talk about who you think will survive for a year?
My guess will be that it's going to be Hillary Clinton, it's going to be Barack Obama.
It's going to be John Edwards.
On the Republican side, it's probably McCain and Mitt Romney and maybe one other - maybe it's Giuliani, because he's got a substantial amount of name I.D.
all the way across the country and probably a fair amount of money that comes with it.
So maybe those six.
Well, that's an interesting one, and I'd say about Rudy, he'll have to get through the thicket of the right-wingers who are homophobes.
But he alone would be the most popular to the public.
But you know, Alan, if the primaries of - let's say if California and New York and Florida go on February 5, he'll win delegates and a lot of them.
That's right.
It's a different - he doesn't have to go to the Iowa caucuses to win delegates.
Gentleman, does anybody write their own speeches anymore when they're running for President?
Or is there just too much to do to do that?
Well, you tell them Bob.
You ran.
One of the things I read when I was on the campaign was letters that Abraham Lincoln wrote from the 1860 campaign, and he was complaining about having to say the same thing over and over and over.
And so that part of it doesn't change.
You do get a little, you know, if you're Alan Simpson's staff, you get a little bored listening to the same damn jokes over and over and over.
And so, you know (unintelligible) you think oh my God, that's my staff and they've got to listen to this corny old joke again.
But I think it's gotten worse as a result of the technology in the last four or five years.
The impact of the blogs and the impact of YouTube and other things like that are - I think they're likely to be that the candidates are even more careful than they have before.
Look, Kerrey, I don't need new jokes.
I need new audiences.
But let me tell you - see, humor is frowned upon now.
Everybody's so serious, but you know, you can always beat these guys back with humor because they don't know how to handle it and they think you're a lightweight because you use it.
But boy, show me a humorless guy and I'll eat his lunch.
Yeah, and also - look, Scott, I know - the only one I don't know is Governor Romney, and I mean they may not be writing every single one of those speeches, but all these individuals are original.

I mean that is to say, they know why they're running and they may have to - you know, they have to rely on staff to prepare some specific speech on, you know, I don't know - the metric tables of ball bearings or something that's completely of the charts that nobody understands.
But I would say, most of the time they'll be forming their own opinions.
Gentleman, it's been a pleasure.
I hope we can talk to you again some time.
I would love it.
Are you hunting down there?
